skill.name: bootstrap
skill.desc: Transform the kernel into a full development environment
skill.overview:
Bootstrap transforms an extracted kernel into a complete dev environment with: - LLXML kernel in development mode (dev/llxml/) - A starter harness project (dev/apps/saddle/)
After bootstrap, you can develop the kernel itself and build projects using it.
skill.result: ``` dev/ ├── llxml/ # Kernel in dev mode │ ├── ll.xml │ ├── main/ # Git repo (kernel source) │ ├── kernel/ # Stable branch worktree │ ├── META/ │ │ ├── backstage.xml # Kernel design context │ │ ├── tickets/{todo,in-progress,review,done}/ │ │ ├── mail/{inbox,read,trash}/ │ │ ├── logs/ │ │ └── reflection/ │ └── ctx/ └── apps/ └── saddle/ # Starter harness project ├── ll.xml ├── main/ # Git repo ├── META/ │ ├── spec/ │ ├── tickets/{todo,in-progress,review,done}/ │ └── mail/{inbox,read,trash}/ └── ctx/ ```

steps.step: ```bash cd dev/llxml mv /path/to/extracted/kernel main mkdir -p META/{tickets/{todo,in-progress,review,done},mail/{inbox,read,trash},logs,reflection} ctx echo '' > ll.xml cd main && git init && git add -A && git commit -m "init kernel" git branch stable && git worktree add ../kernel stable ```

Create `dev/llxml/META/backstage.xml`:
```xml
LLXML kernel development context
LLXML is a self-describing document format for LLM-assisted development. The kernel contains self.xml (format spec) and skills/ (workflows).
What you're working on now.
```
```bash cd dev/apps/saddle mkdir -p main META/{spec,tickets/{todo,in-progress,review,done},mail/{inbox,read,trash}} ctx echo '' > ll.xml cd main && git init ```

Create `dev/apps/saddle/META/spec/saddle.xml`:
```xml
LLXML context harness - assembles project context for LLM sessions
TypeScript, Node.js
- Scan dev roots for ll.xml manifests - Parse LLXML files (app, library, skill, rules, ref) - Assemble context by profile - Output to ctx/
```
Read `kernel/spec/harness.xml` for the full harness specification. Implement saddle in `dev/apps/saddle/main/src/`.
